title: Sampling Frequency
description: Sampling frequency equals reciprocal of sampling period. Units: Hz or samples/second

title: Nyquist Rate
description: Sampling frequency must exceed twice the signal bandwidth W to avoid aliasing

title: Energy of Continuous Signal
description: Total energy of a signal over all time. Finite for energy signals

title: Energy of Discrete Signal
description: Total energy of a discrete-time signal

title: Power of Continuous Signal
description: Average power per unit time for power signals

title: Convolution Integral
description: Output of LTI system equals convolution of input with impulse response

title: Convolution Sum
description: Discrete-time convolution for LTI systems

title: Fourier Series (Trigonometric)
description: Periodic signal representation as sum of sinusoids

title: Fourier Coefficients
formula: a_n = \frac{2}{T}\int_0^T x(t)\cos(n\omega_0 t)dt, \quad b_n = \frac{2}{T}\int_0^T x(t)\sin(n\omega_0 t)dt
description: Coefficients for Fourier series expansion

title: Fourier Transform
description: Transforms time-domain signal to frequency domain

title: Inverse Fourier Transform
description: Recovers time-domain signal from frequency spectrum

title: Time Shifting Property
description: Shift in time causes phase shift in frequency domain

title: Time Scaling Property
description: Compression in time causes expansion in frequency

title: Convolution Theorem
description: Convolution in time domain equals multiplication in frequency domain

title: Frequency Response
description: Transfer function relating output spectrum to input spectrum

title: Modulation Theorem
description: Multiplication by carrier shifts spectrum to carrier frequency

title: Euler's Formula
description: Relationship between exponential and trigonometric functions

title: Impulse Response
description: System output when input is unit impulse; characterizes LTI system

title: Quantization Step
description: Step size for L-level quantizer spanning voltage range

title: Sinusoidal Signal
formula: x(t) = A\sin(\omega_0 t + \phi) = A\sin(2\pi f_0 t + \phi)
description: General sinusoidal signal with amplitude A, frequency f₀, phase φ
